text:
This syntax is the same in different programming languages such as Java and.
The codice_2 identifier means that this method is publicly accessible, that anyone is allowed to use this. In comparison, a method may be codice_2 or sometimes codice_2, the latter of which means only specific parts of the same program are allowed to use this method, and never a human user. A privately accessible method only allows the object it belongs to, to edit it. This is used to give data security.
The codice_2 identifier means that the return type is an integer value.
